name: calcium ammonium nitrate production | calcium ammonium nitrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23475/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of calcium ammonium nitrate (CAN) with 27% N, from liquid ammonia, nitric acid and dolomite. Calcium ammonium nitrate is a fertiliser with 26-27 % N content produced through the neutralisation of aqueous nitric acid by gaseous ammonia. This exothermic process generates an ammonium nitrate solution and steam. The ammonium nitrate is then mixed with a filler that contains dolomite to produce calcium ammonium nitrate. The final product is either prilled or granulated. The process steps are neutralisation, evaporation and solidification.;The main data sources for this dataset are Fertilizers Europe (2014, 2016). Additional data sources are listed as follows.;References:;Fertilizers Europe (2000): Best Available Techniques for Pollution Prevention and Control in the European Fertilizer Industry. Booklet No. 1 of 8: Production of Ammonia. Fertilizers Europe, Brussels.;Kongshaug G. (1998): Energy Consumption and Greenhouse Gas Emissions in Fertilizer Production. IFA 20th July 1998;Davies J., Haglund C. (1999): Life Cycle Inventory of Fertiliser Production. SIK-Report No 654 1999. Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden.;Fertilizers Europe (2014): Average Emissions Year 2011. Fertilizers Europe Environmental report (internal).;Fertilizers Europe (2016): Carbon Footprint Calculator for Fertilizer Production. Specification. Version 2.1;Fertilizers Europe (2016): Average Emissions Year 2014. Fertilizers Europe Environmental report (internal). Used for updated energy and GHG emission in Carbon Footprint Calculator;Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

The activity includes all the raw and processed materials necessary to produce this product. Liquid ammonia, nitric acid, dolomite, heat (as natural gas) and electricity are included. Direct emissions include ammonia and particulate matter to air and nitrogen to water.

The activity ends with the final product being ready for transportation at the production site.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Primary data were collected on fertiliser production for the year 2011. These data were based on annual average data for the year 2011.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The dataset is representative of CAN production in North America, adapted from data collected in European fertiliser plants.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This datasets corresponds to the technology used in North American fertiliser plants. The production of ammonium nitrate involves the combination of liquid ammonia with nitric acid, using heat and electricity.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data were extrapolated from respective data for the geography of Europe, i.e.  production of ammonia and nitric acid are adapted to reflect production in North America.
